channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Replanting of trees, 18th December
item.description:
A Small tree was taken down and never replaced out side no3
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Hill View Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous road surface and drainage issues. Will cause accident soon, 18th December
item.description:
Rapid deterioration of the road at bottom of Aggs Hill from top of Harp hill to Birdlip Road entrance. Heavy surface run off when raining, Uneven road surface and chunks missing from Tarmac. Road becoming dangerous and and accident will occur as a result.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 Large Potholes, 18th December
item.description:
3 Large Potholes in this area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Kingsmead Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gulley emptying, 17th December
item.description:
There are two or possibly three top entry gullies adjacent to the kerb on the roundabout. These are blocked and full of detritus contributing to excess surface water. It would appear they are not on the emptying route sheet as they have never been emptied since the roundabout was constructed in the 1990s
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit 2 Rutherford Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 or 4 meter length of clustered potholes around 10-12 inches in diameter, 17th December
item.description:
Fairly deep, on edge of road into dip, jagged edges
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Hayden Lane, Staverton

item.title: New pothole, 17th December
item.description:
New pothole on pelican crossing west bound side of carriageway in front of school.

item.title: Dead fox on A40(e) near M5J11, 17th December
item.description:
There is a dead fox against the central barrier on the A40 Golden Valley bypass heading into Cheltenham. Near the end of the slip road from the M5J11.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane and pavement, 16th December
item.description:
There are always cars parked half on the pavement and half in the cycle lane, due to missing double yellow lines
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Oak View Shurdington Road, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Quantity of Glass Panes at the location, 16th December
item.description:
The location is the entrance to the Old Quarry on Cleeve Common Road - where a small quantity of glass panes in a poly bag have been dumped. In addition on the Cotaswold Way track going off the entrance is rubbish which has been dropped over time. Please can these be clreared up please. Certainly before the glass is smashed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to Dog Bark Lane, 14th December
item.description:
Both gates missing from entrance to Dog Bark Lane?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars mounting pavement and parking for school run, 14th December
item.description:
Several cars are now mounting the curb and leaving the road completely to drop kids off at school. Given the how busy this road is the only safe place to walk and social distance is down the middle of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 157 Alstone Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle blocking pavement, 14th December
item.description:
Vehicle parked across pavement and blocking pedestrians and forcing mothers and children, old people on to the road, in order to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 School Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing gates, 14th December
item.description:
The gates at the entrance to the Dog Bark Lane bridleway are missing. Is this for maintenance or have they been stolen?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Furzen Lea Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous metal straps sticking out of wall, 14th December
item.description:
Railway station wall - corner of Gloucester Road and Queens Road. Where the stone boundary wall has just been rebuilt - to either side of the rebuilt section metal straps have been left fixed to the wall where the protective site fencing has now been removed. 2 straps either side (2 to Gloucester Road, and 2 to Queens Road). They are DANGEROUS to pedestrians, and need to be removed IMMEDIATELY. The straps were used to secure the protective fencing back to the wall - so when the fencing was removed, why were the metal straps left behind,. attached to the wall??? Lazy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various Coblles loose, 13th December
item.description:
At various points in the car park in front of St Pauls Walk Hub (CBH) the cobbles are loose to the extent is you walk on them they move, I tripped on one that moved up by 5cm as one foot was on one edge and the other clipped the raised side. This is a continous problem as every time it rains the sand bed is washed out from under and when vehicles drive over loosens them more. I can see someone getting hurt quite badly if the situation is not resolved, especially when the kids play in the area, running around. This in the areas outside 15, 16,17,18,19,20 St Pauls Walk, Gl50 4GG

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 15 Saint Pauls Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General household rubbish dumped down alleyway, 13th December
item.description:
Someone has dumped all this household rubbish down an alleyway that I use so now I can’t get my motorcycle through! I notice this only yesterday (12th December 2020) and it’s the alleyway at the back of houses 73, 74 windyridge gardens GL504SZ.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 74 Windyridge Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 116 Melville Road, Churchdown

item.title: Large pothole on Melville Rd just before turning circle, 12th December
item.description:
Pothole is at least 3inches deep and approx 1ft long. Has been there for many months. Located just before turning circle roundabout with tree
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 129 Melville Road, Churchdown

item.title: Branch has been cut back but not far enough, 11th December
item.description:
This branch has been cut back, making it difficult to see in the dark when driving down the hill, it is on the nearside, the mirror of my coach caught the cut off branch and shattered the mirror casing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lilleybrook Golf Club, 313 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
